questiontext.text: A 25-year-old man came to the Oral Surgery Department of RSGM Unhas with the chief complaint of pain in the lower right back tooth. Clinical examination revealed impacted tooth 48. The dentist decided to perform an odontectomy on tooth 48. The dentist conducted the anamnesis as an initial procedure to obtain information/data from the patient. What is the correct method to obtain patient information/data according to the scenario?

answer.text: Through an active communication

questiontext.text: A 25-year-old man came to the Oral Surgery Department of RSGM Unhas with the chief complaint of pain in the lower right back tooth. Clinical examination revealed impacted tooth 48. The dentist decided to perform an odontectomy on tooth 48. The dentist conducted the anamnesis as an initial procedure to obtain information/data from the patient. What communication principles should be applied according to the scenario?

answer.text:
Giving simple answers like “yes” or “no”

  1.
With some interruptions and noisy environments

questiontext.text: A 30-year-old female patient came to RSGM for a routine check-up because her gums often bleed when brushing her teeth. On clinical examination, subgingival calculus was found in the anterior and posterior regions of the lower jaw. The dentist decided to perform scaling in the maxilla and mandibular teeth. In the situation above, what type of informed consent applied?

answer.text:
Express consent – non-verbal

  1.

Implied consent – emergency case

  1.

questiontext.text: A dentist was admitted to the hospital with a diagnosis of hepatitis B since 3 days ago. He had no family history of the disease before. But, after an in-depth anamnesis, it was found that the dentist had performed an odontectomy procedure on a patient suffering from the same disease a month ago without paying attention to the standard precaution protocol. What type of infection probably occurred according to the scenario?

A 34-year-old female patient came to Dental Hospital to remove her maxillary left molar tooth with root remnants. The dentist performs infiltration anesthesia with lidocaine before extraction. Sometime after receiving the anesthesia, the patient felt dizzy, had shortness of breath, edema, and urticaria on his face, a sudden drop in blood pressure, and finally, loss of consciousness. In the situation above, what type of informed consent applied?

answer.text:
Implied consent – emergency case

  1.
Implied consent – usual case

questiontext.text: A 30-year-old male came to the RSGM with impaired masticatory function. The patient lost the lower left molar tooth four years ago. Clinical examination revealed a missing tooth in region 36. The dentist plans to make a dental implant in the edentulous area. In the situation above, what type of informed consent applied?

answer.text: Implied consent – special case
Implied consent – usual case
Implied consent – emergency case
Express consent – special case

questiontext.text: “Environmental conditions contain many complex organisms such as germs, bacteria, fungi and microbiology whose existence can cause disease.” What is the condition explained above?

“Asepsis techniques are all efforts made to prevent the entry of microorganisms into which are likely to result in infection. This action aims to reduce or eliminate microorganisms found on the surface of living or inanimate objects.” What aspects are not included in the principle measures of the condition explained above?

After finishing the treatment for one patient, a dentist in the hospital always asked the cleaning service to do a disinfection procedure on all surfaces of the dental unit before continuing with the next patient. When disinfecting the surface, the cleaning service sprayed all surfaces with phenols liquid. How long is the recommendation to left the surface according to the action performed in the scenario?

A dentist was admitted to the hospital with a diagnosis of hepatitis B since 3 days ago. He had no family history of the disease before. But, after an in-depth anamnesis, it was found that the dentist had performed an odontectomy procedure on a patient suffering from the same disease a month ago without paying attention to the standard precaution protocol. What source can be considered as the route of transmission for direct contact in the scenario?

“A set of infection control practices used to prevent transmission of diseases that can be acquired by contact with blood, body fluids, non-intact skin (including rashes), and mucous membranes. This applies to all patients receiving care in the hospital regardless of their diagnosis or presumed infection status.” What is the concept of infection prevention explained above?

A 25-year-old man came to the Oral Surgery Department of RSGM Unhas with the chief complaint of pain in the lower right back tooth. Clinical examination revealed impacted tooth 48. The dentist decided to perform an odontectomy on tooth 48. Related to the standard precaution component, what is the first thing that should be performed by the dentist before treating the patients?

answer.text: Adhere to sharp handling

questiontext.text: A 25-year-old man came to the Oral Surgery Department of RSGM Unhas with the chief complaint of pain in the lower right back tooth. Clinical examination revealed impacted tooth 48. The dentist decided to perform an odontectomy on tooth 48. Related to the standard precaution component, what type of PPE should be worn by the dentist in the scenario?

A 35-year-old male patient came to the emergency department complaining of a swollen right lower jaw three days ago. The general condition is weak, pale, and a bit congested. Anamnesis revealed that the patient was confirmed positive for COVID-19. Related to the standard precaution component, what type of PPE should be worn by the dentist in the scenario?

The dentist who worked in the dental hospital decided to perform a tooth extraction on tooth 36. When doing the anesthesia, the dentist got a minor incident with a needle stick injury on her finger. What is the first aid management to handle the injury in the scenario?

answer.text: Irrigate the site vigorously with water for 5 minutes
Place the pricked finger into the mouth
Squeeze blood from the wound

questiontext.text: A 40-year-old patient came to the dentist complaining of swelling in the left mandibular region. Based on the history and clinical examination, the patient was diagnosed with ameloblastoma and would undergo surgery. After the surgical procedure, the dentist takes some pathological tissue from the oral cavity for a biopsy examination. The type of action described in the scenario above is included in the classification of pathology…

answer.text: Experimental pathology
Human experiment

questiontext.text: “The progress of a disease process when there is an interaction between agent, host, and environmental factors before man is involved.” What is the phase of condition explained above according to the history of diseases?

answer.text: Pre-pathogenesis

questiontext.text: A dentist was admitted to the hospital with a diagnosis of hepatitis B since 3 days ago. He had no family history of the disease before. But, after an in-depth anamnesis, it was found that the dentist had performed an odontectomy procedure on a patient suffering from the same disease a month ago without paying attention to the standard precaution protocol. Considering the etiology of the disease, what type of disease probably occurred in the scenario?

answer.text: Idiopathic
Congenital

questiontext.text: Disease pathogenesis refers to the sequence of events in the response of the cells, tissues, organs to the injurious stimuli that may lead to disease. In the process of diseases, the normal cell may adapt and respond to the injury by shrinkage the size of the cells. What is the condition of the cell adaptation explained above?

answer.text: Atrophy
Hyperplasia

questiontext.text: A 25-year-old man came to the RSGM complaining that his upper front teeth hurt and that there was an ulcer on the gum. Anamnesis results, one year ago, the upper incisors were treated by a dentist after falling from a motorbike. Six months then, the upper left front tooth hurts, and pus often comes out, the tooth hurts, especially if used to eat, and pus comes out of the fistula. According to the scenario, what kind of inflammation process happen in the patient?

answer.text: Healing process
Acute inflammation
Repair process
Chronic inflammation

questiontext.text: An 18-year-old patient came to the emergency room at RSGM Unhas with a history of traffic accident approximately 2 hours ago, with mild abrasions on his face, arms and legs but accompanied by nausea and vomiting. The patient complains of a headache, and feels like losing balance. The diagnosis of this case is

answer.text: Acute Severe TBI
Acute Moderate TBI
Acute severe TOT

questiontext.text: If in the additional examination of the patient above the patient can still communicate well, and can show a place that hurts with certainty. Based on the awareness rating scale, this patient has GCS;
The purpose of the awareness assessment using the Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) is

answer.text: Determine the degree of severity of speech function
Assess the severity of the fracture that occurred
Determine the extent of facial fracture
Determine the degree of loss of eye function
Determine the severity of the patient's brain dysfunction

questiontext.text: A 30-year-old man was brought to the emergency room at Unhas Hospital with a loss of consciousness after colliding with a car while driving without a helmet. According to eyewitnesses, in four incidents, the patient had fainted, but his pulse and breathing were still palpable, and there was bleeding from the mouth, nose and ears. After examination, the patient still responds to the eye when it is pinched, moans in unclear words, but still makes a sound, and can extend the ladder if there is a painful stimulus. The patient's GCS is
The patient mentioned above from the CT scan shows bleeding in the subdural, the possible diagnosis for this patient is

answer.text: Mild TBI

A 78-year-old patient came to the emergency room at RSGM Unhas with complaints of slight bruising on the chin and loose front teeth but no swelling of the lips. According to the patient's explanation, he fell in the bathroom. Other parts of the body under normal conditions the patient is known to have a history of impaired memory, the patient regularly takes hypertension medication. The patient was diagnosed on the basis of neurological dysfunction as

answer.text: Periodontitis marginalis

questiontext.text: What is the definition of endodontic surgery ?

answer.text: Conditions associated with acute toothache that require rapid treatment
Conditions associated with acute toothache that require rapid treatment
Conditions associated with acute toothache and swelling that require rapid treatment
Conditions associated with periapical disease that require rapid treatment
Conditions associated with swelling that require rapid treatment

questiontext.text: What is the main etiology of endodontic emergency ?

answer.text: It is difficult to make a diagnosis and carry out procedural treatment
The situation is urgent and difficult to determine the diagnosis

questiontext.text: In a state where the pulp and periapical tissues are inflamed, what is it? What etiology could cause this condition?

answer.text: Bacterial invasion through dentinal tubules
The general condition of the patient is deteriorating
Can not be done drainage through the mucosa

questiontext.text: A 46 year old man came to the dental clinic with dental complaints the upper right back has a cavity and hurts since ± 3 days ago. patient some time to take painkillers. Intra oral examination of tooth 16 caries D6, site 2, size 3. Vitality test (+), percussion (-). Periapical radiographs appeared normal. What is the diagnosis of this case?

answer.text: Infusion of Criytalloid and Transfussion of Blood continue with surgery
Infusion of Crystalloid and Transfussion of Blood

answer.text:
Inflammation of the periradicular tissue caused by the pulp
necrosis

Inflammation of the pulp tissue caused by inflammatory exudate

questiontext.text: A 25 year old man comes to the dental clinic with dental complaints lower right back throbbing pain since ± 3 days ago. The patient has trouble sleeping although several times taking painkillers. Dental intra-oral examination 46 caries D6, site 2, size 3. Vitality test (+). What is the primary key handling on the case?

A 51 year old man comes to the dentist with dental complaints lower left back pain when used to chew. Dental clinical examination 37 (D6, site 1, size 2), sensitivity test (-), percussion (+), and palpation (-), picture Radiographically there is widening of the periodontal ligament. Looks patch Class 1 amalgam in good condition. What is the diagnosis based on 37 AAE classification?
A 30 year old patient came with bleeding condition. Emergency clinician diagnosed the patient with Class II of Haemorhagic Shock. What is the emergency condition according to the scenario ??

answer.text: Blood loss more than 40 % of blood volume
Blood loss up to 15 % of blood volume
Blood loss up to 10 % of blood volume

questiontext.text: In anaphylactic shock condition, what is the settle position recommend as to start the emergency measure ?

answer.text: supine with elevated leg around 20-30 cm high

questiontext.text: In anaphylactic shock condition, what is the dosage of the injection of epinephrine ?

Anaphylactic shock is categorized as what type of hypesensitivity ?
How much is average circulating blood in healthy adult ?

answer.text: 90-100 ml/kg of blood circulating at any given time
30-40 ml/kg of blood circulating at any given time
40-50 ml/kg of blood circulating at any given time
70-90 ml/kg of blood circulating at any given time

questiontext.text: What is initial evaluation and resucitation in sepsis condition ?

answer.text: Early recognition of sepsis assess - Establish an airway - Circulation.Ensuring adequate oxygenation - Evaluate breathing
Early recognition of sepsis assess - Circulation.Ensuring adequate oxygenation - Establish an airway - Evaluate breathing
Early recognition of sepsis assess - Establish an airway - Evaluate breathing - Circulation.Ensuring adequate oxygenation
Circulation.Ensuring adequate oxygenation - Establish an airway - Evaluate breathing
